glsa.title: CUPS: Stack overflow in included Xpdf code
glsa.synopsis: CUPS includes Xpdf code and therefore is vulnerable to the recent stack overflow issue, potentially resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: The Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) is a cross-platform print spooler. It makes use of Xpdf code to handle PDF files.

description.p: The Decrypt::makeFileKey2 function in Xpdf's Decrypt.cc insufficiently checks boundaries when processing /Encrypt /Length tags in PDF files (GLSA 200501-28).

impact.p: This issue could be exploited by a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code by sending a malicious print job to a CUPS spooler.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
